intro: Hexaptera jussiaei var. tridens, commonly known as the three-toothed hexaptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three lobes, giving it the common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and stamens. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as savannas and forest edges.
